content:
Sorry if this is the wrong stream for this but...

I'm guessing a good way to start getting involved in Rust development is to start going through the old issue trackers and finding stuff to close or bugs to fix? I've recently mostly finished work on a massive PR, and have learned a fair bit about core development in the process, and am wondering where I could be most useful next.

I've previously submitted a few issues for error diagnostics, so that may not be a bad place to start?

@Alexander Huszagh (He/Him) sure - if you're interested in diagnostics talk to @Esteban KÃ¼ber. There are a bunch open on the issue tracker, if there's any with E-mentor you could start with those. Feel free to grab anything that interests you though :)
